Package pieces

Class Piece

java.lang.Object
pieces.Piece
Direct Known Subclasses:
Bishop, King, Knight, Pawn, Queen, Rook
public abstract class Piece
extends java.lang.Object
Abstract class which represent a single Piece

      public boolean getColor()
      Get the color of a Piece
      Returns:

      Get the set of all the allowed positions where a Piece can move
      Returns:
      A set a Coord

    • move

      public Piece move​(Coord startC, Coord finalC, ChessGameInterface inter)
      Move a Piece from a position to another A
      Parameters:
      startC - Coord of the Piece
      finalC - Coord of the final position
      inter - The instance of the interface (CommandLine or Graphic)
      Returns:
      The Piece that has been eaten, or null

    • moveForAllowedMove

      public Piece moveForAllowedMove​(Coord startC, Coord finalC)
      Different implementation of move
      Parameters:
      startC - Coord of the Piece
      finalC - Coord of the final position
      Returns:
      The Piece that has been eaten, or null

    • demove

      public void demove​(Coord startC, Coord finalC, Piece pEat)
      Undo a move
      Parameters:
      startC - Former position the Piece which has moved
      finalC - Current position of a Piece
      pEat - The Piece that has been eaten, or null

    • allowedMove

      public boolean allowedMove​(Coord c)
      Check if there is a possible movement for a certain Piece
      Parameters:
      c - The Coord of the concerned Piece
      Returns:
      The Piece could still move

    • possibleOrImpossible

      public boolean possibleOrImpossible​(Piece p)
      Compare the color of a Pieces to the current one
      Parameters:
      p - A Piece
      Returns:
      They haven't the same color
